meanings.definition: To make a determined effort to deal with (a problem or difficult task)
meanings.sent1: She tackled the challenging math problem until she understood it.
meanings.sent2: He tackled the messy room by organizing one section at a time.
meanings.sent3: The determined student tackled the tough assignment with a positive attitude.
meanings.sent4: She tackled the obstacle course like a champion, overcoming each hurdle.
meanings.sent5: He tackled the project head-on, showing great determination.

meanings.definition: To seize, catch, or take hold of
meanings.sent1: The player tackled the ball and ran towards the goal.
meanings.sent2: She tackled the runaway puppy before it could escape.
meanings.sent3: The quick reflexes of the goalkeeper allowed him to tackle the speeding ball.
meanings.sent4: He tackled the opportunity to learn a new skill with enthusiasm.
meanings.sent5: She tackled the problem by grabbing it firmly and finding a solution.

meanings.definition: To engage in a physical confrontation with (someone)
meanings.sent1: The football player tackled his opponent to stop him from scoring.
meanings.sent2: She tackled her brother playfully during their game.
meanings.sent3: The friends tackled each other in a friendly wrestling match.
meanings.sent4: He tackled the bully to protect his friend from harm.
meanings.sent5: She tackled the challenge of the sparring match with determination.
